result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Tellez Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio Tellez Perez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio Tellez Perez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Antonio Tellez Perez was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any treatment, counseling and evaluation per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Tellez Perez in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees and understands.  Court goes through rights and sentence recommendation with defendant.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2 & 3:
2 years Probation, concurrent
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
AODA & treatment
$243.00 costs x 2 and $200.00 DNA surcharge x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Count 1 Dismissed
